column1: #Text=and other desirable properties as is necessary for the functioning as described herein.
#Text=It been found that if a plastic grocery bag is tied shut with articles of laundry and water inside, and a vacuum applied inside the bag, the grocery bag collapses due to atmospheric pressure.
#Text=This collapse presses the water out of the articles of laundry inside the bag.
#Text=Even more water is extracted by both mechanical and evaporative removal, when air is repeatedly allowed to re-enter the evacuated bag and the bag again evacuated.
#Text=This method of water extraction is ideal for an automatic washing machine using a flexible bag for the washing container.
#Text=The reduced atmospheric pressure at higher elevations may require artificial assistance.
#Text=This reduced atmospheric pressure can be assisted easily by doubling the bag such that one bag is inside the other.
#Text=Supplemental air pressure could be applied between the two bags to assist the atmospheric pressure in collapsing the inner bag, thus effectively wringing the water from the laundry.
#Text=This method of supplemental air pressure may be used even at sea level if dryer laundry is desired.
#Text=Thus, the spin cycle of prior art washing machines is eliminated.
#Text=With the spin cycle gone, the heavy parts requirement is gone.
#Text=It may seem paradoxical that replacing big parts with small parts, metal with plastic and rigid with flexible, will improve the capacity and the cleaning properties of a washing machine.
#Text=However, the result has been empirically verified.
